page.title: 12Bungy Barnes retires
page.content: Bungy bought{2 of his 6 heavy {horses }from the Elephant and Castle in London. A horse drawn self binder was used for cutting the corn until his first tractor, a{Case, came in {1938.}The corn was put into stooks then ricks then threshed. In 1950 Bungy had his first{combine {harvester.}The{outbuildings}were used as a cowpen, milking parlour, pig rearing pen and sheep pen. The sheep were shorn by hand driven shears. {Bungy retired in 1961 but continues to {live in Yarde in a house built on his {former land by a retiring school {mistress in the mid thirties.}Although retired, he works full time in his {half acre garden}so that he and Eileen are{self sufficient}in fruit and vegetables.Both early morning and afternoon they walk their dogs over the local fields and lanes.
